data.name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Elegant Sole
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Beast Game-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card. If this Pokémon has at least 7 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 3 more Prize cards instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.

abilities.name: Pupate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds bird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.

attacks.name: Triple Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, It stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, It stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

abilities.name: Irresistible Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent's Bench isn't full, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals their hand. Put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto their Bench.

data.name: Vileplume
data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

abilities.name: Varied Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose Asleep, Burned, Confused, or Poisoned. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Venonat
data.flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

attacks.name: Radar Eyes
attacks.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Venonat
data.flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Bellsprout
data.flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

data.name: Venomoth-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shinobi Mastery
attacks.text: If you played Koga's Trap from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage. If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ten-Card Return-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Venomoth
data.flavorText: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.

attacks.name: Assassin Flight
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition. This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Chlorowhip
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 2 Grass Energy attached to it, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Weepinbell
data.flavorText: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

attacks.name: Burning Venom
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

data.name: Victreebel
data.flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gastro Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon has no Abilities until the end of your next turn.

data.name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Double Blaze-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fire Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage, and this attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: While it's quite friendly toward humans once it's grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.

data.name: Grubbin
data.flavorText: If you find its nest, you shouldn't stick your hand inside. You'll get bitten by an irritated Grubbin.

attacks.name: Electrical Signal
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Kartana
data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

attacks.name: Big Cut
attacks.text: If you have exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: False Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general and conquering a whole country.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Darmanitan
data.flavorText: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.

attacks.name: Find Wildfire
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Fire Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Darumaka
data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Volcanion
data.flavorText: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

attacks.name: Flare Starter
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you go second and it's your first turn, instead search for up to 3 Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: High-Heat Blast
attacks.text: If you have at least 4 Fire Energy in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Torracat
data.flavorText: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer's whole body covered in scratches.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Incineroar
data.flavorText: Although it's rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

abilities.name: Strong Cheer
abilities.text: Your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Strong Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.

attacks.name: Grass Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

abilities.name: Roast Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

data.name: Blacephalon
data.flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

attacks.name: Blazer
attacks.text: Turn 1 of your face-down Prize cards face up. If it's a Fire Energy card, this attack does 50 more damage. (That Prize card remains face up for the rest of the game.)

attacks.name: Fireball Circus
attacks.text: Discard any number of Fire Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Wartortle
data.flavorText: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Blastoise-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rocket Splash
attacks.text: Shuffle any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon into your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each card you shuffled into your deck in this way.

attacks.name: Giant Geyser-GX
attacks.text: Attach any number of Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Poliwag
data.flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Poliwhirl
data.flavorText: Although it has become capable of living on land, it spends its time in the water, where its prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Poliwag
data.flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

abilities.name: Round ‘n' Round
abilities.text: You can use this Ability only if you go second. Once during your first turn (before your attack), you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Confused.

data.name: Poliwrath
data.flavorText: It's quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its time on land.

attacks.name: Swirly Rush
attacks.text: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl are on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.

attacks.name: Bubble Jutsu
attacks.text: If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.

attacks.name: Wicked Tentacles
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on the Pokémon you moved the Energy to.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: There are some places where Slowpoke is worshiped because of a long-standing belief that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Dewgong
data.flavorText: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It's especially fond of Wishiwashi.

attacks.name: Dual Blizzard
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder, breaks off.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Three Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads. If all of them are tails, you lose this game.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

data.name: Kingler
data.flavorText: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Seaking
data.flavorText: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.

attacks.name: Enhanced Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, flip 6 coins instead.

data.name: Goldeen
data.flavorText: Although known for their splendid tail fins, Goldeen apparently compete among themselves to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.

attacks.name: Elegant Swim
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Kyurem
data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

attacks.name: Call Forth Cold
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hail Prison
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Froakie
data.flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Pyukumuku
data.flavorText: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Surprise Fist
attacks.text: You and your opponent play Rock-Paper-Scissors. If you win, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Frogadier
data.flavorText: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

attacks.name: Afterimage Strike
attacks.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

data.name: Dedenne-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dedechange
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Tingly Return-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.

attacks.name: Never Give Up
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have at least 3 more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. Attach all Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Stunfisk
data.flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electric Trap
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

data.name: Charjabug
data.flavorText: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you'll get a shock!

abilities.name: Battery
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Vikavolt or Vikavolt-GX as a Special Energy card. This card provides 2 Lightning Energy only while it's attached to a Pokémon.

data.name: Zeraora
data.flavorText: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

attacks.name: Crushing Claw
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Vikavolt
data.flavorText: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.

abilities.name: Stealthy Body
abilities.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Electricannon
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Poison Absorption
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo Mix-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 15 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Arbok
data.flavorText: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Heavy Choke
attacks.text: If this Pokémon used Wrap during your last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

attacks.name: Glare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: It has no eyeballs, so it can't see. It checks its surroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Golbat
data.flavorText: Every once in a while, you'll see a Golbat that's missing some fangs. This happens when hunger drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Crobat
data.flavorText: Its fangs are so sharp, if it bites you in the dark and sucks your blood, you won't notice any pain or realize you've been bitten.

abilities.name: Sound Veil
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.

abilities.name: Swelling Spite
abilities.text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out, search your deck for up to 2 Haunter and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Drowzee
data.flavorText: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it's best not to go out walking around.

attacks.name: Sinister Fog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: You can hear tales told all over the world about how Gengar will pay a visit to children who are naughty.

abilities.name: Shadow Pain
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in any way you like.

attacks.name: Twilight Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: In Alola, Komala is Hypno's main target. It rarely harms people.

abilities.name: Hypnotic Pendulum
abilities.text: When your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, choose which of your opponent's Benched Pokémon becomes their new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stir the Brain
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.name: Weezing
data.flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

abilities.name: Detention Gas
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Basic Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Splattering Sludge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mew
data.flavorText: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

abilities.name: Bench Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Mewtwo
data.flavorText: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.

abilities.name: Mind Report
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Espurr
data.flavorText: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Ear Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each damage counter on that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Marshadow
data.flavorText: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.

abilities.name: Resetting Hole
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Red Knuckles
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Mismagius
data.flavorText: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.

abilities.name: Mysterious Message
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. If you drew any cards in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Meowstic
data.flavorText: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Perplexing Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon's Weakness is now Psychic until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

data.name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Acme of Heroism-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), and if it would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Sandshrew
data.flavorText: It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger approaches, it curls up into a ball to protect its soft stomach.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Graveler
data.flavorText: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: It travels through tunnels that it digs underground. It hates sunlight, so it comes out only after the sun goes down.

abilities.name: Underground Work
abilities.text: If you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Giovanni's Exile, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Sandslash
data.flavorText: Its claws and horns often break off. The broken claws and horns can be used to carve plows for tilling farm fields.

attacks.name: Continuous Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Dugtrio
data.flavorText: While the three of them normally get along splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will break out over which head gets to eat first.

attacks.name: Home Ground
attacks.text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Golem
data.flavorText: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 20 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Cubone
data.flavorText: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother, but those cries only attract its natural enemy—Mandibuzz.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Beat attack's base damage is 80.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

data.name: Marowak
data.flavorText: It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down. It's thought that Marowak is trying to avenge its parent.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Assault Boom
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Dirty Work
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If you played Giovanni's Exile from your hand during this turn, discard the top 5 cards instead.

data.name: Rhyperior
data.flavorText: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

attacks.name: Hefty Cannon
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

data.name: Quagsire
data.flavorText: It has a sluggish nature. It lies at the river's bottom, waiting for prey to stray into its mouth.

data.name: Gligar
data.flavorText: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Shinobi Strike
attacks.text: If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Gliscor
data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tyrogue
data.flavorText: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

abilities.name: Bratty Kick
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.name: Hitmontop
data.flavorText: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by 10.

attacks.name: Finishing Combo
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if your Hitmonlee used Special Combo during your last turn. This attack does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Landorus
data.flavorText: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields."

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Crabrawler
data.flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

attacks.name: Knuckle Blast
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Stakataka
data.flavorText: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

abilities.name: Wall of Stone
abilities.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this Pokémon's maximum HP is 200.

attacks.name: Top Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Crabominable
data.flavorText: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

attacks.name: Fight Alone
attacks.text: If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 50 more damage for each Pokémon fewer you have in play.

data.name: Honchkrow-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ruler of the Night
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Feather Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Unfair-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 cards from it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Greninja & Zoroark-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Union-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokémon-GX and Darkness Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to each Pokémon that you put onto your Bench in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Krookodile
data.flavorText: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp Panic
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: They're such cowards that they won't hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

abilities.name: Building Spite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 1 damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Anguish Cry
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.

attacks.name: Grandiose Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, this Pokémon's attacks do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon during your next turn (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Sharpedo
data.flavorText: People believe that carrying one of its discarded fangs will prevent mishaps at sea, so the fangs are made into accessories.

abilities.name: Greedy Evolution
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Darkness Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Bad Fangs
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Greninja
data.flavorText: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

attacks.name: Bring Down
attacks.text: The Pokémon that has the least HP remaining, except for this Pokémon, is Knocked Out. (If multiple Pokémon are tied, choose one.)

attacks.name: Mist Slash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles and holds them in place.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Lucario & Melmetal-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Fist
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Full Metal Wall-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Metal Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Diglett
data.flavorText: Although it's powerful enough to dig right through volcanic rock, it doesn't allow itself to be seen very often.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio
data.flavorText: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.

abilities.name: Hair Wall
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Malamar
data.flavorText: When it comes to strong hypnosis, there's an endless number of people who utilize Malamar for their nefarious deeds.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Reign
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may discard a Pokémon you find there and use one of that Pokémon's non-GX attacks as this attack.

attacks.name: Dark Pressure
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Genesect
data.flavorText: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

abilities.name: Fast-Flight Configuration
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Splitting Beam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Meltan
data.flavorText: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

attacks.name: Steel Melt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Metal Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Gardevoir & Sylveon-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fairy Song
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Kaleidostorm
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Magical Miracle-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: It concentrates its mental energy and fires off mysterious waves called auras, which can crush boulders of large size to dust.

attacks.name: Rush Up
attacks.text: If you attached a Pokémon Tool card from your hand to this Pokémon during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Melmetal
data.flavorText: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.

abilities.name: Metal Eater
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Metal Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cleffa
data.flavorText: On nights with many shooting stars, they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you should see them, something good will happen!

abilities.name: Excitable Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, shuffle your hand into your deck and then draw 6 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Spritzee
data.flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Lairon
data.flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Aggron
data.flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

attacks.name: Extra-Tight Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Clefable
data.flavorText: It can't help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren't many people or Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moon-Watching Dance
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it.

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur, this Pokémon is sought after. Holding one in your arms while you sleep feels great.

attacks.name: Orb Polish
attacks.text: Put 3 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Togepi
data.flavorText: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Togetic
data.flavorText: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

attacks.name: Energy Present
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Aromatisse
data.flavorText: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.

attacks.name: Pungent Aroma
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is heads, your opponent reveals their hand. For each heads, choose a card you find there. Your opponent shuffles those cards into their deck.

attacks.name: Miraculous Cologne
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.name: Spearow
data.flavorText: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect its territory.

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Togekiss
data.flavorText: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.

abilities.name: Fairy Feast
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokémon.

data.name: Whimsicott-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fluffy Cotton
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Energy Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toy Box-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life. If its incisors get too long, this Pokémon becomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.

data.name: Fearow
data.flavorText: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!

attacks.name: Drill Run Double
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Raticate
data.flavorText: People say that it fled from its enemies by using its small webbed hind feet to swim from island to island in Alola.

attacks.name: Escaping Incisors
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over shiny objects.

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.

attacks.name: Double Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Dodrio
data.flavorText: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Accelerating Stab
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Accelerating Stab during your next turn.

data.name: Persian
data.flavorText: Although the jewel on its forehead appears to be a different color than those of Alolan Persian, it's mostly made of the same material.

abilities.name: Gathering of Cats
abilities.text: Ignore all Energy in the attack costs of each of your Pokémon in play that has the Caturday attack.

data.name: Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cat Walk
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if 1 of your Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Cat Walk Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile. You can't add more than 180 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Slash Back-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lickilicky
data.flavorText: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is…more than 82 feet.

attacks.name: Eat Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, heal all damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tonguenado
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Porygon2
data.flavorText: AI has been installed in it. It learns various things all on its own, but it even remembers things it doesn't need to know.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: It doesn't do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.

abilities.name: Lazy Eating
abilities.text: Between turns, heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Counter
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a TAG TEAM, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Glameow
data.flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Boing Boing Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is apparently due to the incompetence of the engineer who updated its programming.

abilities.name: Crazy Code
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Special Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Happiny
data.flavorText: Usually it's a well-behaved Pokémon, but if you take its round rock away, it will cry and fuss and throw a big old tantrum.

abilities.name: Playhouse Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.name: Chip-Chip Ice Axe
rules: Look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck and choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles the other cards back into their deck. Then, put the card you chose on top of their deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dusk Stone
rules: Search your deck for a Mismagius, Honchkrow, Chandelure, or Aegislash, including Pokémon-GX, that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon in play, and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. You can use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Electromagnetic Radar
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Lightning Pokémon-GX and Lightning Pokémon-EX, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Janine
rules: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Devolution Spray Z
rules: Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon by shuffling any number of Evolution cards on it into your deck. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Martial Arts Dojo
rules: The attacks of non-Ultra Beast Pokémon that have any basic Fighting Energy attached to them (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If the attacking player has more Prize cards remaining than their opponent, those attacks do 40 more damage instead.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Metal Core Barrier
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your opponent's turn.

abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Tingly Return-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Poison Absorption
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo Mix-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 15 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Greninja & Zoroark-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Union-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokémon-GX and Darkness Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to each Pokémon that you put onto your Bench in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Celesteela-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Force Canceler
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects of your opponent's GX attacks, including damage, done to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Discovery-GX
attacks.text: Count your Prize cards and put them into your hand. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards. If you don't have that many cards in your deck, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Triple Acceleration Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Evolution Pokémon. If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of the turn.
This card provides ColorlessColorlessColorless Energy only while it is attached to an Evolution Pokémon.
If this card is attached to anything other than an Evolution Pokémon, discard this card.
